metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: フィギュア ペア “りくりゅう” 金メダル 日本勢で初 五輪
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートのペアで三浦璃来選手と木原龍一選手の“りくりゅう”ペアが逆転での金メダルを獲得しました。オリンピックのこの種目で日本勢がメダルを獲得したのは初めてです。

all.headline: ジャンプ 男子スーパーチーム 日本は6位 雪強まり競技打ち切り
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプの新種目、男子スーパーチームで日本は6位でした。最後の3回目の1人目で2位に浮上しましたが、雪が強まった影響で競技が打ち切りとなり2回目までの成績で順位が決まったためメダル獲得はなりませんでした。記事後半では、試合の経過を詳しくお伝えしています。

all.headline: 日本が獲得したメダル18個に 過去最多の前回・北京大会に並ぶ
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックで日本が獲得したメダルがあわせて18個となり、過去最多の前回、北京大会に並びました。

all.headline: 東広島 男性死亡 窓ガラス割られ押し入った人物に襲われたか
all.description: 16日、広島県東広島市の住宅から火が出て、消火活動中に敷地内で男性が首から血を流して死亡しているのが見つかった事件で、住宅の1階の窓ガラスが割られ、何者かに侵入された形跡があったことが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。警察は窓から押し入った人物に襲われたとみて、殺人事件として捜査しています。

all.headline: 政府・自民 国民会議早期開始で調整 食料品消費税2年間ゼロで
all.description: 食料品の消費税を2年間ゼロにする自民党の公約実現に向けて、政府・自民党は、野党に参加を呼びかけて超党派の「国民会議」で早期に議論を始めたいとして調整を急ぐ方針です。

all.headline: 香港強盗事件 実行役の被告“犯行後に依頼の男から報酬”供述
all.description: 香港で、日本人の男性が多額の現金を奪われた事件で、現地の検察当局は、逮捕・起訴された実行役とされる日本人の被告が、現金を奪うよう依頼され犯行後に報酬を支払うと告げられていたと供述していることを明らかにしました。

all.headline: ロシア報道官 和平協議“領土問題など より幅広い議論行う”
all.description: ロシアとウクライナの和平案をめぐり、アメリカを交えた協議が17日からスイスで行われる予定で、ロシア大統領府の報道官は「領土問題などに焦点をあて、より幅広い議論を行う」と述べました。

all.headline: Taiwan parliament to tackle defense spending review from Monday
all.description: The move comes amid pressure from a bipartisan group ⁠of U.S. lawmakers that has expressed concern about parliament stalling the proposed defense ​spending bill.

all.headline: Japan’s Miura and Kihara take pairs gold after brilliant free skate
all.description: Miura and Kihara put together their best free skate of the year on Monday, earning 158.13 points, thunderous applause and, most importantly, an Olympic gold medal.

all.headline: 'Luffy' crime ring member sentenced to life in prison
all.description: Of the four arrested and indicted senior members of the crime ring, Toshiya Fujita, 41, was the second to receive a sentence.

all.headline: Rice prices remain high in Japan even after stockpile releases
all.description: The country's staple food law stipulates that releases of government-stockpiled rice be used to cover "supply shortages due to falling production."

all.headline: Mizuho Securities reportedly faces probe for insider trading
all.description: The revelations are the latest to potentially undermine confidence in Japan’s financial industry at a time when the stock market is booming.

all.headline: Takaichi-Ueda meeting most notable for what might not have been said
all.description: The prime minister not putting pressure on the central bank's governor could prove to be significant.

all.headline: Japan's economy barely grew in fourth quarter and just avoided recession
all.description: Japan's economy grew less than expected and just avoided a recession, with gross domestic product growing 0.2% annualized in the fourth quarter.

all.headline: Youthful USA Stars prevail in NBA's new All-Star Game format
all.description: The three-team round-robin tournament of short 12-minute games was the latest incarnation of the ever-changing All-Star Game format.

all.headline: Man pleads not guilty to triple murder in Saitama Prefecture
all.description: According to the indictment, Jun Saito killed U.S. national William Ross Bishop Jr., his wife, Izumi Morita, and their daughter.

all.headline: What Trump wants from Russia
all.description: A U.S.-Russia arrangement in which Ukraine is little more than a bargaining chip risks hollowing out this project before it is consolidated.

all.headline: Japan’s Updated ‘Free and Open Indo-Pacific’ Initiative to Strengthen Cooperation on Economic Security with Like-Minded Nations
all.description: Japan’s newly updated Free and Open Indo-Pacific initiative will strengthen cooperation on economic security with like-minded nations in the Indo-Pacific region, according to a draft revision revealed

all.headline: Ruling Coalition Calls for Opposition Participation in ‘National Council’ to Discuss Consumption Tax Reduction, Refundable Tax Credits
Young People in Japan Grapple with Social Media Addiction
all.description: Young people ages 10 to 29 appear to have the highest rate of pathological social media use, with 6% exhibiting signs of a serious addiction, according to a survey by an addiction treatment institutio

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Speed Skater Miho Takagi Extends Olympic Medal Haul to 9, Has Most Among Japanese Female Athletes for Summer, Winter Games
Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Dual Mogul Silver Medalist Ikuma Horishima Inspired by Former Champion Shinji Osada When Competing in Milan
all.description: “If you keep dreaming, the dream will be realized. If you put effort in without giving up, it will pay off.”

all.headline: Revitalization of Shipbuilding Industry: Counter Chinese, S. Korean Competitors through Technological Innovation
all.description: Can Japan’s shipbuilding industry launch a counteroffensive and regain its position, having been overshadowed by Chinese and South Korean competitors? Japan must chart a path to revival as a major shi

all.headline: Sexual Abuse by Doctors: Despicable Acts that Betray Patient Trust
all.description: There is no end to incidents involving indecent acts committed by doctors and nurses against patients. Some of the victims are minors.

all.headline: Osaka Expo Mascot Myaku-Myaku-Themed Cafe Opens in Osaka, Set to Run Through Thursday
Japanese Shares Dip as Soft Data, Post-Election Lull Cap Moves
all.description: TOKYO, Feb 16 (Reuters) - Japanese shares drifted lower on Monday as weaker-than-expected economic data and a post-election lull capped moves.

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: 500-Meter Bronze Gives Miho Takagi Drive For Top Race; Training Struggles Paid Off For Veteran Speedskater
all.description: Speedskater Miho Takagi threw herself into her coach’s arms as her third-place finish was confirmed.

'Dragged out and set on fire' - the Bangladesh mob killing that shocked the world
all.description: In December, Hindu factory worker Dipu Das was lynched in Bangladesh, igniting global outrage.

all.headline: Bondi Beach shooting accused faces court for the first time
all.description: The 24-year-old faces 59 charges, including 15 counts of murder and one of committing a terrorist attack.

all.headline: Sydney police plead for return of man, 85, kidnapped by mistake
all.description: Police say they're 'a million percent confident' Chris Baghsarian was not the intended target.

all.headline: ByteDance to curb AI video app after Disney legal threat
all.description: Videos featuring Spider-Man and other characters which are Disney's intellectual property have gone viral since Seedance's update.

all.headline: Is this a 'very Chinese time in your life'? The trend boosting China's soft power
all.description: Chinamaxxing is adding more gloss to the recent flourish of Chinese soft power.

all.headline: After the landslide: Can India reset ties with a BNP-led Bangladesh?
all.description: A reset of the frayed relationship is possible, say analysts. But it will require restraint - and reciprocity.

all.headline: The two Chinese-American Olympians competing for rival superpowers
all.description: Eileen Guo and Alysa Liu have been thrust into a debate that goes far beyond sports.

all.headline: British couple held by Taliban describe 'culture shock' returning to UK
all.description: Peter and Barbie Reynolds were released by the Taliban in September after being detained for seven-and-a-half months.

all.headline: Australia's Liberal Party ousts first woman leader
all.description: Sussan Ley, plagued by poor polls, was deposed by Angus Taylor after just nine months in the job.

all.headline: Japan says it seized Chinese vessel amid tensions with Beijing
all.description: The fishing boat tried to flee when ordered to stop for an inspection inside Japan's territorial waters, authorities say.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: フィギュア ペア “りくりゅう” 金メダル 日本勢で初 五輪
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートのペアで三浦璃来選手と木原龍一選手の“りくりゅう”ペアが逆転での金メダルを獲得しました。オリンピックのこの種目で日本勢がメダルを獲得したのは初めてです。

primary.headline: ジャンプ 男子スーパーチーム 日本は6位 雪強まり競技打ち切り
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スキージャンプの新種目、男子スーパーチームで日本は6位でした。最後の3回目の1人目で2位に浮上しましたが、雪が強まった影響で競技が打ち切りとなり2回目までの成績で順位が決まったためメダル獲得はなりませんでした。記事後半では、試合の経過を詳しくお伝えしています。

primary.headline: 日本が獲得したメダル18個に 過去最多の前回・北京大会に並ぶ
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピックで日本が獲得したメダルがあわせて18個となり、過去最多の前回、北京大会に並びました。

primary.headline: 東広島 男性死亡 窓ガラス割られ押し入った人物に襲われたか
primary.description: 16日、広島県東広島市の住宅から火が出て、消火活動中に敷地内で男性が首から血を流して死亡しているのが見つかった事件で、住宅の1階の窓ガラスが割られ、何者かに侵入された形跡があったことが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。警察は窓から押し入った人物に襲われたとみて、殺人事件として捜査しています。

primary.headline: 政府・自民 国民会議早期開始で調整 食料品消費税2年間ゼロで
primary.description: 食料品の消費税を2年間ゼロにする自民党の公約実現に向けて、政府・自民党は、野党に参加を呼びかけて超党派の「国民会議」で早期に議論を始めたいとして調整を急ぐ方針です。

primary.headline: 香港強盗事件 実行役の被告“犯行後に依頼の男から報酬”供述
primary.description: 香港で、日本人の男性が多額の現金を奪われた事件で、現地の検察当局は、逮捕・起訴された実行役とされる日本人の被告が、現金を奪うよう依頼され犯行後に報酬を支払うと告げられていたと供述していることを明らかにしました。

primary.headline: ロシア報道官 和平協議“領土問題など より幅広い議論行う”
primary.description: ロシアとウクライナの和平案をめぐり、アメリカを交えた協議が17日からスイスで行われる予定で、ロシア大統領府の報道官は「領土問題などに焦点をあて、より幅広い議論を行う」と述べました。

primary.headline: Taiwan parliament to tackle defense spending review from Monday
primary.description: The move comes amid pressure from a bipartisan group ⁠of U.S. lawmakers that has expressed concern about parliament stalling the proposed defense ​spending bill.

primary.headline: Japan’s Miura and Kihara take pairs gold after brilliant free skate
primary.description: Miura and Kihara put together their best free skate of the year on Monday, earning 158.13 points, thunderous applause and, most importantly, an Olympic gold medal.

primary.headline: 'Luffy' crime ring member sentenced to life in prison
primary.description: Of the four arrested and indicted senior members of the crime ring, Toshiya Fujita, 41, was the second to receive a sentence.

primary.headline: Rice prices remain high in Japan even after stockpile releases
primary.description: The country's staple food law stipulates that releases of government-stockpiled rice be used to cover "supply shortages due to falling production."

primary.headline: Mizuho Securities reportedly faces probe for insider trading
primary.description: The revelations are the latest to potentially undermine confidence in Japan’s financial industry at a time when the stock market is booming.

primary.headline: Takaichi-Ueda meeting most notable for what might not have been said
primary.description: The prime minister not putting pressure on the central bank's governor could prove to be significant.

primary.headline: Japan's economy barely grew in fourth quarter and just avoided recession
primary.description: Japan's economy grew less than expected and just avoided a recession, with gross domestic product growing 0.2% annualized in the fourth quarter.

primary.headline: Youthful USA Stars prevail in NBA's new All-Star Game format
primary.description: The three-team round-robin tournament of short 12-minute games was the latest incarnation of the ever-changing All-Star Game format.

primary.headline: Man pleads not guilty to triple murder in Saitama Prefecture
primary.description: According to the indictment, Jun Saito killed U.S. national William Ross Bishop Jr., his wife, Izumi Morita, and their daughter.

primary.headline: What Trump wants from Russia
primary.description: A U.S.-Russia arrangement in which Ukraine is little more than a bargaining chip risks hollowing out this project before it is consolidated.

tweets: Congratulations to Yukima Horishima, the men's freestyle skiing dual mogul, who won the first silver medal in men's moguls in Japan at the Milan-Cortina Olympics, and Miho Takagi, the women's speed skater, who won her second bronze medal in the 500m speed skating event!

We are very grateful to have received the beautiful red and white plum blossoms from everyone at Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine, including Chief Priest Nishitakatsuji.
Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine is famous for the god of learning, Michizane Sugawara.
We are currently in the midst of exam season, and I pray that all examinees across the country will demonstrate their full potential.

Today, members of the Liaison Committee for Families of Victims Abducted by North Korea and the National Council for the Rescue of Japanese Abducted by North Korea came to the Prime Minister's Office to receive the ``Future Campaign Policy'' that was decided yesterday.
The official mascot character of the Yokohama Green Expo, ``Tunk Tunku,'' placed at the entrance of the official residence, can now talk.

On February 12, a Fisheries Agency fisheries inspection vessel discovered a Chinese fishing boat in Japan's exclusive economic zone west of Yakushima and ordered it to stop for an on-site inspection by a fisheries inspector, but the vessel failed to comply and fled, so the captain was arrested under Article 15-2, Paragraph 1 and Article 18 of the Act on the Exercise of Sovereign Rights Regarding Fisheries, etc. in the Exclusive Economic Zone.
